isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - INSTALL - IGNITION SWITCH AND IGNITION SWITCH CYLINDER

svcproc.title: IGNITION SWITCH AND IGNITION SWITCH CYLINDER

svcprocinfo.para: The ignition switch and door locks are coded the same so that one key operates ignition switch and door locks. The code number is stamped and bar coded on a plastic bag that the ignition switch and door lock cylinders are supplied in at the assembly plant. This plastic bag is to remain with the vehicle when it is delivered to the customer. It is very important that this plastic bag be kept by the customer in a safe, secure place, so that if a replacement key is required, the key can be replaced.
The code number does not appear on ignition switch body or door lock assembly.

svcsubproc.title: Install Ignition Switch Cylinder into Ignition Switch on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models
svcsubproc.para: If the original key is desired when replacing the ignition switch cylinder, code the new ignition switch accordingly. Use the following steps:
Refer to Figure 203 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Insert original key (Item 1) in new ignition switch cylinder (Item 2). Before insertion into ignition switch body, file off tumblers that protrude from cylinder. Make certain that no burrs are left on tumblers, and that all filings are blown out with compressed air.

figure.caption: Figure 203. Original Key in New Switch Cylinder

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 34 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To reinstall same ignition switch cylinder, or to install a new ignition switch cylinder (Item 1), apply a small quantity of powdered graphite to tumblers, then insert ignition switch key (Item 3) into ignition switch cylinder (Item 1) . Rotate ignition key and ignition switch cylinder counterclockwise to accessory position and insert ignition switch cylinder back into ignition switch body (Item 2). Turn key to Off position and remove key.

svcsubproc.title: Install Ignition Switch on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 31 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position ignition switch (Item 2) at dash panel and connect ignition switch connector (Item 1) to back of ignition switch.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 30 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Position ignition switch (Item 2) up behind dash panel (Item 1) and insert it into dash panel opening.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 29 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: With ignition switch (Item 3) pushed through dash panel (Item 1) and positioned properly, using a 1 1/8 inch thin wall socket, install mounting cap nut (Item 4) securing it to dash panel. Tighten snugly.
Install rubber trim (Item 2) around ignition switch (Item 3).
